meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Wendy Hardenberg Sami Siegelbaum Julia Collins Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6850.

td.p: Wendy Hardenberg, a university librarian from New Haven, Connecticut
Sami Siegelbaum, a professor of art history from Chicago, Illinois
Julia Collins, a supply chain professional from Kenilworth, Illinois (whose 19-day cash winnings total $410,000)

tr.td: THE ANIMAL IN THE LOGO
POKER
TALK CLEANLY TO ME
SINGLE-NAMED SINGERS' HITS
THE ROARING '20s
THE RODIN MUSEUM

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_5_1', 'clue_J_5_1_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew points to a map on the monitor.) In 1927 it took Charles Lindbergh 33-1/2 hours to fly from Long Island to this metropolis; today, it takes around 8 hours, & people don\'t mob you for getting there successfully')

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew points to a map on the monitor.) In 1927 it took Charles Lindbergh 33-1/2 hours to fly from Long Island to this metropolis; today, it takes around 8 hours, & people don't mob you for getting there successfully

')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex delivers the clue from the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia.) For 37 years, Rodin worked on "The Gates of Hell", adding & removing figures; the subject matter of the doors is based on this epic poem by Dante

The original marble is in the Paris Rodin museum; the Philadelphia Rodin Museum has a replica, made after Rodin\'s death, of this iconic sculpture in which a pair of lovers embrace')

tr.td: (Alex delivers the clue from the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia.) The original marble is in the Paris Rodin museum; the Philadelphia Rodin Museum has a replica, made after Rodin's death, of this iconic sculpture in which a pair of lovers embrace

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_3', 'clue_J_6_3_stuck', '(Alex delivers the clue from the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia.) Rodin was so successful at authentically sculpting the human body that he was accused of using molds from a live model in the piece known as "The Age of" this--also the material from which the statue was cast')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

In 1347 the English king Edward III agreed to lift an almost year-long siege of a French port city if 6 townsmen would sacrifice themselves; in this sculpture, Rodin shows the emotion of each of the men as they trudge to their death')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

In 1347 the English king Edward III agreed to lift an almost year-long siege of a French port city if 6 townsmen would sacrifice themselves; in this sculpture, Rodin shows the emotion of each of the men as they trudge to their death

')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

tr.td: Julia
Sami
Wendy

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Julia
Sami
Wendy
A REAL MAC DADDY
POETIC LINES
(Alex: Next, we'll give you the [*], you identify the poem for us.)
THE 28 COUNTRIES OF NATO
DESCRIBING THE TV CAST
TWO OF A KIND
WHAT A "CO"-INCIDENCE
(Alex: Each correct response will end in those two letters--"C-O".)

"The Song of Hiawatha"

Sami
')

Sami
